Over the past two decades, Uganda's civil war has forced hundreds of thousands of families into miserable camps. Now, buoyed by recent peace talks, many are clustering into less-cramped "return camps." Senior writer Roger Burks spent a night alongside displaced families in one of these makeshift villages, Ogonyo, where Mercy Corps is helping residents support themselves while they await the day they can return home.

Learn more > SPOTLIGHT
Mercy Corps works every day to unleash the power and potential of people who can win against impossible odds.

Q&A: R.E.M. Frontman Michael Stipe

Hurricane Katrina deeply shook Michael Stipe - and he saw a need to help. Since then, he has been an ardent supporter of our programmes to help hurricane survivors, a champion for rebuilding Gulf Coast communities and a clear voice of action.

Learn more >
Behind the Horn of Africa's Brewing Storm

Randy Martin, director of Global Emergency Operations, discusses the worsening conditions on the Kenya-Somalia border, where Mercy Corps is delivering critical supplies amid the growing concerns of a regional war.
Read more > Tsunami: Two Years Later

Mercy Corps is helping communities in tsunami-affected areas of Indonesia. Since December 2004, we've assisted more than 1 million survivors with innovative programmes designed to "build back better."
Read more > Holiday Shopping Made Easy

We would like to introduce our new online shop, which features Christmas cards, decorations and calendars.  Your holiday purchases help us fund critical projects in more than 35 countries around the world.
